author: Riyan Ramanath V
title: Bid to make Bhubaneswar socially smart
text:
BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Smart City Limited (BSCL) on Monday started a people-connect programme with United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) at Jagannath slum here to make the city socially smart. 

Development of socially smart city is one of the components of Smart City Mission. The BSCL has signed an MoU with UNFPA for the project, which will include capacity building, knowledge sharing and behavioural and self-defence training of girls in slums. 

All the eight slums that will be targeted in different phases are located in Bhubaneswar Town Centre District (BTCD) area, which is a 985 acre demarcated area meant for development under smart city mission. The BTCD will turn into a model downtown of the capital city, said an officer of the BSCL. 

The UNFPA and the BSCL officials interacted with slum dwellers to know the details about their living status, education, basic amenities and dropout rate of schoolchildren. 

In November, 2016 the UNFPA country representative for India and Bhutan Diego Palacios and BSCL signed the agreement. The project, whose cost is Rs 1.6 crore, will run initially till the end of December 2017. It will be extended after assessing the impact, official sources said.
